message.content:
cs.FL, cs.DM, cs.LO, cs.GT, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with weighted automata, which are a formalism used to describe quantitative properties. This falls under the category of formal languages and automata theory (cs.FL). The paper also discusses the problem of minimizing the size of a union of sequential WA, which is related to the area of discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The use of Lipschitz-like machine independent property and cost register automata suggests a connection to computational complexity theory (cs.CC) and graph theory (cs.DS). The paper also mentions the use of decision procedures, which is related to the area of control theory (cs.SY). Overall, the most likely sub-category is cs.FL, followed by cs.DM, cs.LO, cs.GT, and cs.SY.
